pageContext.claim: “So I hate the crime. I hate what's done. I hate the cover-up. And I will tell you this: The crown prince hates it more than I do. And they have vehemently denied it. The CIA points it both ways. You know, it's -- as I said, maybe he did, maybe he didn't.”
pageContext.analysis: The CIA has assessed with high confidence that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered the assassination of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Senators briefed on the matter by CIA Director Gina Haspel said the evidence is compelling. Trump's habit of casting doubt on his intelligence agencies' findings and conclusions, including on Khashoggi's killing, "has become a source of mounting concern to senior U.S. intelligence officials," according to The Washington Post's Greg Miller.
